A cannonball is loaded into a cannon. Then, someone fires the cannon, creating an explosion that sends the cannonball forward and the cannon backwards.
The cannon has a mass of 1100 kg.
The cannonball has a mass of 8.4 kg
Before the explosion, both the cannon and the cannonball are stationary.
After the explosion:
The cannonball has a speed of 323 m/s forward.
What is the velocity (magnitude and direction) of the cannon?
This is called the recoil velocity.
problems.answer: The cannon moves at a speed of 2.5 m/s backwards.
